examples: This accompt has been made to appear a bull accompt, i.e. that the bulls cannot take their stock. The fact is the reverse; it is a bear accompt, but the bears, unable to deliver their stock, have conjointly banged the market, and pocketed the tickets, to defeat the rise and loss that would have ensued to them by their buying on a rising price on the accompt day  [â€¦]

verbs.description: accompt (third-person singular simple present accompts, present participle accompting, simple past and past participle accompted)
